item.title: Disappeared person's dependants can use victim's property
item.description: Dependants of a victim of enforced disappearances now can use the victim's property sans any permission under provision of a draft law that remedies existing painful wait of many. The Advisory Council of the interim government in its meeting Thursday approved the draft of two ordinances-one rela

item.title: NBR launches digital truck tracking system at Benapole land port
item.description: The National Board of Revenue (NBR) has introduced a new "Truck Movement" sub-module under the ASYCUDA World system to digitally track the entry of cargo-laden trucks from India and the exit of empty vehicles. The initiative aims to strengthen monitoring, transparency and revenue protection, acc

item.title: July Revolution sought constitutional renewal, not repeal: Chief Justice
item.description: Chief Justice (CJ) Dr Syed Refaat Ahmed on Thursday said the July Revolution did not aim to overturn the Constitution, but rather to renew and strengthen the nation's engagement with it. He made the remarks while responding to a farewell felicitation accorded to him by Attorney General Md Asaduz

item.title: US launches review of advanced Nvidia AI chip sales to China, sources say
item.description: US President Donald Trump's administration has launched a review that could result in the first shipments to China of Nvidia's second-most powerful AI chips, five sources said, making good on his pledge to allow the controversial sales. Trump this month said he would allow sales of Nvidia's H200 c

item.title: Inqilab Mancha urges people to avoid violence
item.description: Inqilab Moncho on Friday urged people to refrain from any form of violence over the death of its spokesperson Sharif Osman Bin Hadi who died at a Singapore hospital on Thursday a week after a gun attack on him. In a Facebook post, the socio-cultural platform—formed in the wake of the July Re

item.title: Australia plans gun buyback after Bondi massacre, as surfers honour victims
item.description: Australia will launch a national gun buyback scheme following the mass shooting in Sydney, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Friday, as hundreds of surfers and swimmers paddled out at Bondi Beach to honour victims. The buyback would be similar to gun reforms introduced soon after the massacr

item.title: NCP’s Hannan Masud files GD over ‘death threats’
item.description: Abdul Hannan Masud, the senior joint chief convenor of the National Citizen Party (NCP) and the party’s candidate for the upcoming Noakhali-6 parliamentary election, has allegedly received death threats. Masud’s uncle Shamsul Tibriz, the chief convenor of the NCP’s Hatiya Upazila

item.title: As global scrutiny grows, Chinese firms look to call Singapore home
item.description: A growing number of Chinese companies are looking to domicile in Singapore, betting a move to the trade-focused city-state would reduce risks their operations get disrupted by Sino-US geopolitical tensions. The trend, billed as "Singapore washing" by some analysts, started gaining traction near th

item.title: Police chief inspects Daily Star, Prothom Alo buildings after arson attack
item.description: Inspector General of Police (IGP) Baharul Alam has gone to inspect the damage to the buildings housing the Dhaka head offices of major newspapers Prothom Alo and The Daily Star. He arrived for the inspection of the two buildings at 9am on Friday. Abdullah Al Imran, additional deputy commissioner

item.title: Attacks on two leading newspapers amount to an attack on the free press, says CA Yunus
item.description: Chief Advisor Muhammad Yunus has spoken to the editors of leading daily newspapers Prothom Alo and The Daily Star over the phone following the attacks on their Dhaka offices. The Chief Advisor’s Office said Yunus conveyed his deepest sympathies to Prothom Alo Editor Matiur Rahman and Daily S

item.title: Family calls for memorial to slain activist Osman Hadi at Shahbagh
item.description: The family of Sharif Osman Hadi, the Inqilab Moncho convenor who died after being shot in Dhaka, has called for a memorial to be built in his honour at Shahbagh. After news of Hadi's death broke on Thursday, relatives gathered at his family home in Jhalakathi's Nalchity on Friday. Several family m

item.title: Inquilab Moncho shares image of ‘Hadi's coffin’
item.description: Inquilab Moncho on Friday shared the coffin of Sharif Osman Bin Hadi, spokesperson of the platform, who passed away while receiving treatment in Singapore on Thursday.
